decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and disruptive creatures. It aims to generate value by recurring key creatures with Ephemerate and utilizing Elemental synergies with cards like Risen Reef and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an additional layer of synergy and consistency. With a mix of reactive spells and powerful creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a slower, grindy game.

This UB Mill deck focuses on using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Archive Trap to mill the opponent's deck quickly. It features control elements like Remand, Crypt Incursion, and Drown in the Loch to disrupt the opponent's plan while milling them out. Surgical Extraction helps to remove key cards from the opponent's graveyard, while Tasha's Hideous Laughter can mill a large portion of their deck at once. The key strategy is to quickly mill the opponent's deck and disrupt their game plan with control spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cast low-cost spells and cascade into powerful threats like Crashing Footfalls using cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells like Fury and Force of Negation. Seasoned Pyromancer provides card advantage and token generation, while Brazen Borrower and Cryptic Command offer versatile interaction. The land base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck focuses on explosive plays and tempo advantage to quickly close out games.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around quickly assembling the Colossus Hammer combo, utilizing Puresteel Paladin and Sigarda's Aid to equip Colossus Hammer to a creature for a deadly surprise attack. The deck also focuses on protecting its key pieces with Giver of Runes and Esper Sentinel, while utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for important artifact pieces like Stoneforge Mystic and Cranial Plating. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a powerful, efficient combo that can end the game in just a few turns.

The deck is focused on controlling the game through a mix of counterspells, removal, card advantage, and tempo plays. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently building up its own resources. Using versatile instant spells like Counterspell and Archmage's Charm, along with powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Murktide Regent, the deck can quickly shift gears between defense and offense. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Brazen Borrower adds additional disruption and flexibility to the deck's game plan, making it a versatile and adaptable control deck.

The deck focuses on quickly playing cheap cascade spells to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. By utilizing cards with cascade abilities, the deck can constantly put pressure on the opponent and generate valuable card advantage. With the addition of Yorion as a companion, the deck gains additional value and resilience. The mana base is optimized to support the various colors needed for the spells in the deck. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm and outpace the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful counter spells and removal, utilizing a combination of planeswalkers, enchantments, and instants. By denying the opponent resources and disrupting their strategy, the deck aims to maintain board control and out value the opponent. With an emphasis on card advantage and versatile answers to threats, it seeks to outlast opponents in long, drawn-out games. The inclusion of the companion Kaheera adds additional synergy and resilience to the overall strategy of the deck.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six to manipulate the game state, and powerful creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Eternal Witness to close out the game. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for a larger starting deck size, giving more options and resilience to the control strategy. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on assembling the key pieces to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently, allowing the player to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Urza's Saga ahead of schedule. The combination of Amulet of Vigor, Azusa, Lost but Seeking, and cards like Arboreal Grazer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove allows for explosive turns and the ability to search for important lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and interaction, while the deck utilizes lands and land-based synergies to generate overwhelming advantages on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Colossus Hammer equipment on a creature, such as Memnite or Ornithopter, and attack with it for a large amount of damage. The deck relies on cards like Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic to help tutor for and equip the Colossus Hammer efficiently. With the support from cards like Esper Sentinel and Giver of Runes, the deck aims to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game with powerful, early attacks.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful equipment combo using creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter along with cards like Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic. The key card, Colossus Hammer, is crucial to the strategy, as it can be attached to a small creature to create a massive threat. The deck also includes cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Urza's Saga to provide additional value and consistency in executing the combo. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swift and devastating equipment-based combo.

The primary goal of this Combo - Hammer Time deck is to quickly assemble a powerful board presence by equipping Colossus Hammer onto small creatures like Memnite, Ornithopter, or Puresteel Paladin. By using cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Sigarda's Aid to tutor and cheat equipment cards into play, the deck can create an explosive combination that can deal a lot of damage in a short amount of time. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion that provides additional staying power and recursion for valuable cards. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive and synergistic strategy.
